pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Horcrux is a Proxmox VE alternative built natively for Gentoo Linux, combining enterprise-grade virtualization with full-featured NAS capabilities.
It provides virtualization management with support for QEMU/KVM, LXC containers, Docker, and Podman, plus comprehensive NAS functionality rivaling TrueNAS and FreeNAS. Horcrux embraces the Gentoo philosophy of choice by offering extensive USE flags for customization.
Virtualization Features: - Multi-hypervisor support (QEMU/KVM, LXD, Incus) - Container runtimes (LXC, Docker, Podman) - Multiple storage backends (ZFS, Ceph, LVM, NFS, CIFS, iSCSI) - Software-defined networking with VXLAN and VLANs - High availability clustering with Corosync/Pacemaker - Automated backups with retention policies - Live VM migration - VM templates and cloning - Cloud-init integration
NAS Features: - File sharing protocols: SMB/Samba, NFS, AFP/Netatalk, WebDAV, FTP/SFTP - Storage management: ZFS pools/datasets, Btrfs, mdraid, LVM - Snapshot management with periodic scheduling and retention policies - ZFS send/receive and rsync-based replication - User/group management with quota support - POSIX and NFSv4 ACL management - Time Machine backup target for macOS - S3-compatible object storage via MinIO gateway - iSCSI block storage targets - Authentication: Local users, LDAP, Kerberos, Active Directory
Platform Features: - Role-based access control (RBAC) - OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication - Web-based management interface (Yew/WebAssembly) - RESTful API for automation - Advanced monitoring with OpenTelemetry - Alert system with multiple notification channels

use.flag: Enable QEMU/KVM hypervisor support for hardware virtualization
Enable LXD support for system containers and VMs
Enable Incus support (LXD fork) for containers and VMs
Enable LXC container support
Enable Docker container runtime support
Enable Podman (daemonless) container runtime support
Enable ZFS storage backend with native snapshot support
Enable Ceph RBD distributed storage backend
Enable LVM storage backend with snapshot support
Enable automated backup and restore functionality
Enable high availability clustering with Corosync
Enable TLS/SSL support for encrypted connections
Enable LDAP/Active Directory authentication
Build and install WebAssembly-based web management interface
Install systemd service unit (default: OpenRC init script)
Enable NAS functionality - file sharing, user management, storage pools
Enable SMB/CIFS file sharing via Samba (Windows/cross-platform)
Enable NFS server for Unix/Linux file exports with NFSv4 support
Enable AFP file sharing via Netatalk for macOS clients
Enable WebDAV file access over HTTP/HTTPS via nginx
Enable FTP/SFTP server via ProFTPD with SSL support
Enable OpenLDAP server for centralized directory services
Enable MIT Kerberos 5 authentication for secure single sign-on
Enable Active Directory domain integration via Samba (requires kerberos)
Enable macOS Time Machine backup target support (requires afp)
Enable S3-compatible object storage API via MinIO
Enable iSCSI target for network block storage via tgt
Enable rsync daemon for efficient file synchronization and backups
Enable ZFS pool/dataset management optimized for NAS workloads
Enable Btrfs subvolume and RAID support for NAS
Enable Linux software RAID (mdadm) for NAS storage
Enable LVM thin provisioning for NAS storage
